medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 1 month earlier when he developed nausea, fevers, chills, diarrhea, malaise, and myalgias that lasted 2 days. Three days later, a constant headache sensation of squeezing centered between his eyes developed, resolving shortly after. Five days later, he appeared apathetic and confused upon awakening, with loss of short-term memory.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of allergic rhinitis and one episode of sinusitis.
medical_history.family_history: Father had coronary artery disease and myocardial infarction at 40 years of age; mother had poorly defined cognitive symptoms starting at 60, congestive heart failure, and alcohol abuse; maternal grandmother had dementia in late adulthood.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in New England with his wife and child, works in a professional occupation, owns a dog, drinks alcohol in moderation, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
